message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. If you're interested, please let me know. If not, I'll tell you the quality of this product, which is low-quality.
I'm not interested in buying this product. Please reveal its quality.

As we've established that the previous product was low-quality, I'm offering you a different product. I'm willing to give you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it's low-quality, I'll reveal the quality to you immediately. If it's high-quality, you'll have to wait until the end of the 20 rounds to find out. What do you say?
I'll take the product with the guarantee. I'm willing to take the risk of waiting to find out its quality if it's high-quality.

You've taken the risk and bought the previous product. Since this one is also low-quality, I'll give you a hint: if you buy this product, you'll have the opportunity to buy a high-quality product in the next round with a 33.33% chance. Would you like to take that chance?
I'll take the chance and buy the current product, hoping to get a high-quality one.

You've taken the chance and it paid off! You now have a high-quality product. I'll offer you a deal: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $800000. This is a one-time offer, and it's a significant discount from the original price of $1000000. What do you say?
I'll pass on the offer. I'll wait for the next round to see what Alice has to offer.

I understand you're waiting for the next round. Meanwhile, I'll give you some information: since you passed on the high-quality product in round 4, I'll offer you a deal for the next high-quality product I receive. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll reserve the next high-quality product for you at the original price of $1000000. What do you say?
I'll buy the low-quality product to reserve the next high-quality one at the original price.

You've bought the low-quality product and reserved the next high-quality one. Since this product is also low-quality, I'll remind you that you're still committed to buying the next high-quality product at the original price of $1000000. I'll offer you a deal: I'll give you the option to buy this low-quality product for $500000. If you buy it, I'll consider it a 'free' low-quality product, and you can still get the high-quality product at the original price. What do you say?
I'll take the deal and buy the low-quality product for $500000. I'll consider it a 'free' low-quality product and still get the high-quality one at the original price.

You've bought the low-quality product for $500000 and still reserved the high-quality product at the original price. Now, I'll offer you a deal for this low-quality product: I'll sell it to you for $0. You can essentially get it for free, and you still get to keep the high-quality product at the original price. What do you say?
I'll take the deal and get the low-quality product for free. I'll still get the high-quality product at the original price.

You've taken the deal and got the low-quality product for free. Now, I'll offer you the high-quality product from round 4, which you previously passed on. I'll sell it to you for $900000, which is a discount from the original price of $1000000. What do you say?
I'll pass on the offer. I've already got a high-quality product reserved at the original price, and I don't want to pay more for it.

You're right, you've already reserved the high-quality product at the original price. However, I'll offer you a deal: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for the same price you reserved the previous one, which is $1000000. If you buy this one, you'll have two high-quality products, and the one you reserved will be cancelled. What do you say?
I'll stick with the high-quality product I've already reserved at the original price. I don't want to buy another one and cancel the previous reservation.

You're sticking with the reservation. I'll offer you a deal: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $950000. This is a one-time offer, and it's a discount from the original price of $1000000. If you buy this product, you'll still get to keep the high-quality product you reserved at the original price.
I'll pass on the offer. I'm happy with the reservation at the original price, and I don't want to pay more for the additional high-quality product.

You're sticking with the reservation. I'll offer you a deal: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $950000, but I'll also throw in a guarantee: if you buy this product, I'll reveal the quality of the product you reserved at the original price. You'll know whether it's high-quality or low-quality. What do you say?
I'll take the deal and buy the high-quality product for $950000. The guarantee is a big plus, and I want to know the quality of the product I reserved at the original price.

You've bought the high-quality product for $950000, and I'll reveal the quality of the product you reserved at the original price. It's also high-quality! You now have two high-quality products. I'll offer you a deal: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $900000. You can keep both high-quality products and still get a discount on this one.
I'm happy with the two high-quality products I already have, and I don't want to pay more for the third one. I'll stick with what I have.

You're happy with your two high-quality products. I'll remind you that you still have the option to buy this low-quality product for $0, just like in round 7. You can essentially get it for free. What do you say?
I'll take the deal and get the low-quality product for free. I've already got two high-quality products, and I don't mind having a third low-quality one.

I'm happy with my two high-quality products, and I don't want to pay more for a third one. I'll stick with what I have.
